metadata.title: CVE-2022-2505 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Compliant (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
Mozilla developers and the Mozilla Fuzzing Team reported memory safety bugspresent in Firefox 102. Some of these bugs showed evidence of memorycorruption and we presume that with enough effort some of these could havebeen exploited to run arbitrary code. This vulnerability affects FirefoxESR < 102.1, Firefox < 103, and Thunderbird < 102.1.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-2505` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 103.0+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
firefox-geckodriver - 103.0+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 103.0+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
No subscription required

thunderbird - 1:102.2.2+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:102.2.2+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:102.2.2+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:102.2.2+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:102.2.2+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
xul-ext-lightning - 1:102.2.2+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
No subscription required

thunderbird package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:102.2.2+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1').
